revisionDesc.change: Finalized - This is good to go.
Add dummy header for original identifier 'papyri.info/ddbdp/sb;3;7205' pointing to new identifier 'papyri.info/ddbdp/p.nekr;;23'
Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - Looks good. Add |subts| tags in l. 3 as per app. crit.; add |reg| tags in l. 4 as per app. crit.; remove dot in |reg| tags in l. 14.

Submit - Added DDbDP text. Lin3 "δ corr. from κ with start of ρ": one could enter <:δικαιοκρισείᾳ|subst|κρικαιοκρισεια:>, but this would be misleading; lin4 'l. ἡγεμόν' not entered deliberately; lin8 em dashes replaced by comma.

Commit - Added DDbDP text. Lin3 "δ corr. from κ with start of ρ": one could enter <:δικαιοκρισείᾳ|subst|κρικαιοκρισεια:>, but this would be misleading; lin4 'l. ἡγεμόν' not entered deliberately; lin8 em dashes replaced by comma.

Vote - AcceptText - lin4: in terms producing an easily understandable text I prefer πρὸς <σ>έ. lin5: κατ᾽ ἐμὲ̣ is indeed relatively difficult to make out, but the parallels make a convincing case. The space is probably slightly too small for ου and to the right of the Delta there is what could well be the last section of the middle stroke of an epsilon.

Vote - AcceptText - I would render this with reg tag minus the pointy brackets → <:πρὸς σέ|reg|πρὸς έ:> (one could of course represent the haplography also as <:πρὸς σέ|reg|πρὸ σέ:> or simply <:πρὸς σέ|reg|προσε:>). BL reading in ln 5 is fine. As for κατ᾽ ἐμὲ̣, it is difficult to verify this on the small photo in the ed.pr., but on the basis of the parallels cited, I am willing to accept it.
Automated transfer of accents across reg-orig pairs
batch converted all tei:sic to tei:orig and tei:corr to tei:reg
changed schema; added xml:space=preserve; indented; moved title/@n to idno
Converted from TEI P4 (EpiDoc DTD v. 6) to P5 (EpiDoc RNG schema)
